nz.co.abrahams.asithappens
Class DataSets

java.lang.Object
  nz.co.abrahams.asithappens.DataSets
Direct Known Subclasses:
FlowData
public class DataSets
extends java.lang.Object

Stores sets of collected data. The following assumptions are made about the nature of the data.

  1. An arbitrary number of data "sets" can be stored.
  2. Each set has a corresponding textual heading.
  3. Data values in a set have at some point been collected periodically over some length of time.
  4. Data values in a set are ordered. Conceptually, each value within a data set has an index. A value with a lower index has always been collected before a value with a higher index. Indicies start at zero.
  5. The time of each collection "event" is stored in a set of times. Each time value is represented by the number of milliseconds since midnight, Jan 1, 1970, GMT.

DataSets objects may keep a handle to a database. This is useful for storing values in the database as collected, or querying the database to create data sets from previously stored data.

Author:
mark

DataSets

public DataSets(DataType dataType,
                DataCollector collector,
                Device device,
                int pollInterval,
                java.lang.String portString,
                int direction,
                java.lang.String title,
                boolean storing)
         throws DatabaseException,
                java.net.UnknownHostException,
                SNMPException
Creates a new instance of DataSets that has an active collector.

Parameters:
dataType - the type of data contained
collector - the collector that populates the data sets
device - the target collection device
pollInterval - the polling interval in milliseconds
portString - the text description of the associated port if any
direction - the direction of data flow for the collection
title - the title of these sets of data
storing - indicates that data will be stored into the database
Throws:
DatabaseException
java.net.UnknownHostException
SNMPException

                int aggregation)
         throws DatabaseException

Parameters:
sessionID - index in database that uniquely identifies session
startTime - beginning of desired time period
finishTime - end of desired time period
aggregation - the aggregation strategy employed for larger data sets
Throws:
DatabaseException

collect

public void collect()
Collects a single data value for each data set.

This method undertakes the following tasks as a part of collecting:

  • invokes getNextValues() of the collector and adds the resulting values to the end of each data set
  • adds the collected values to the database if database storing is enabled
  • removes the oldest data values if the size of the data sets exceeds the maximum limit

Parameters:

deviceName - name of target collection device

direction - direction that the collection pertains to

Returns:

stopCollecting

public void stopCollecting()
Stops the collector. This includes releasing any collector resources and marking the session as "not collecting" in the database if the session is being stored.

parseResults

public void parseResults(int aggregation)
                  throws DatabaseException
Retrieves data sets information from the database. The object's session ID must be set before calling this.

The results in a given set will be aggregated if there are more than the specified maximum in the configuration option "data.points.fetched.maximum".

Parameters:
aggregation - the aggregation strategy employted for large data sets
Throws:
DatabaseException

Returns:
labels for this data
